content.label: simpler and more engaging than scrabble. strategy beats cheaters. good for coffee breaks. have a few simultaneous games; some only play a turn or two daily

title.label: One of the best word games out there

content.label: I only play against the bots, but it‚Äôs a very challenging and fun game.
This game relaxes the body and stimulates the brain at the same time.
I‚Äôve been addicted to this game. I play multiple games everyday religiously!!
My favorite & only game I continue to play. Love the upgrades!!

My favorite word game to date! The strategic element of the game is quite fun and unique, and pushes the limits of your vocabulary better than any word game I‚Äôve played. Huge recommend!

Developer Suggestion - Perhaps add a speed mode, where turns are limited to a few minutes. Fun feature in other competitive games. üëç
Love the strategies the need to be used.   Forces you to think.  Only drawback are those immediate pop ups after a game is complete.  It becomes annoying at times.

I got this game after Hasbro allowed Scrabble Go to become an abortion and an insult to the universe and adults everywhere. This is definitely not scrabble but still fun to play with friends. However, I wish their game rules were more explicit about how this game is scored. After 3 weeks of play we still haven‚Äôt  figured out how the program scores each play. Also, there is something about defending squares that makes no sense either. If the publishers are listening please explain this stuff clearly. 
Also, consider making different letters have different scores like scrabble does and offering games that go to higher totals like ü•∫50 and 75. Those would add an element of strategy that is missing.

I love playing this game with my spanish speaking relatives but it seems that the spanish selection feature was taken out. Why?!? It works amazing! To this day i can STILL play in spanish with those who added it to the app when you guys said yall released it for testing i think, but now anyone who is new to this game and downloads has NO WAY of accessing the spanish language version of this app. Truly frustrating and dissappointing. When i email the developers, they say they have no idea how i even have access to such a function even though i send screenshots of the game taking action in spanish ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

I very much enjoy playing, but find the Letterpress Dictionary baffling and frustrating.  Letterpress recognizes non-words while refusing widely-used words.  Letterpress should adopt a universally recognized source such as Merriam-Webster.

Also, LP considers ‚Äúrealtor‚Äù a proper noun, but recognizes ‚Äúlawyer‚Äù as a common noun. Where‚Äôs the logic there?

I‚Äôm glad they revived this game with bots, because I really missed it. However, the addition of archaic, questionable, and foreign words is not fun.
Examples include: worser and cocas which are words, not in current English though. Then there are gibberish ‚Äúwords‚Äù like chatties, splatched and personnels
This is a good game except you should definitely be able to have more than 2 players in a game. Please fix this.
I never get bored with this game‚Äîthe need for strategic planning adds a interesting dimension that most word games simply lack. Excellent.

title.label: Handicap for Second Player would make this 5-Stars

content.label:
A great game that would be 5-stars if some kind of handicap was implemented for the player playing second. 

Right now the first player gets an overwhelming and often insurmountable head start. 

Some possible ways to even the odds:
1. Limit the length of the first played word
2. Limit the number of blockable tiles of the first played word. 
3. Lower threshold for victory for second player and increase for first player. Maybe 11-14 is enough for second player to win but first player needs 14-11 to win. 

None of these would take away from the general enjoyment of the game and would make for interesting decisions at the beginning and during the game. 

Even without this though, LetterPress is a great game that I‚Äôve played for many months now and continue to enjoy. A great combination of vocabulary and strategy in a very elegant app.

title.label: How do I delete all my old games? I have thousands of them.

content.label: Lovely game.

I‚Äôm really enjoying the game.  However, instructions are unclear as to how to actually play the game.  This includes scoring, letter blocking, and exchange.  My queries to LetterPress resulted in a non-specific response.   I‚Äôm muddled through and figured most of it out on my own.  I have learned a lot by playing against the Bots.  Alll that being said, it‚Äôs a fun and challenging activity.
Could you add another bot? Bot 1 is much too easy. Bot 2 is good.... but I‚Äôd really like you to add another bot with difficulty somewhere between number 1 and number 2. Great game, thanks!
Fun and east to play, but a simple warning don‚Äôt play against your parents.
You know what else this game needs?  I don‚Äôt know either!

I've played like 11 times, and have lost like 1 to 24 every time. And I'm pretty darn good with words. It could use some tinkering. The computer plays tons of big words and can not keep up...
In short terms: Needs work

I am updating this review because the most recent update seems to have corrected the issues I mention below. Now if only the game was better at screening out non-words.  Too many words with no definition are accepted yet legitimate ones are not. Proper nouns are not supposed to b allowed yet too many times ones such as ‚Äúspartan‚Äù are disallowed while others are allowed with the definition that it is either a specific person‚Äôs name and capitalized. I think spartan may actually be allowed, finally, but that is the type of thing that still happens. Or else a noun that isn‚Äôt ever used as a verb has a suffix such as ‚Äú-ing‚Äú added to it yet it isn‚Äôt a word in any dictionary. Nor can it be used in a sentence. Other than that, this is a great game that I enjoy immensely. 

I‚Äôd like to update this review in response to the developer‚Äôs response of ‚ÄúSwipe on the Game Over section label to remove all completed games. ".  

I‚Äôve already stated that swiping the label didn‚Äôt get rid of the completed games.  They‚Äôd reappear almost instantly, sometimes bringing games as old as 600+ days old back into my queue.  The only way to really get rid of them is to swipe each game individually.
 
The labels have returned as mysteriously as they had disappeared but I still have ‚Äúwaiting for turn‚Äù games in the ‚Äúyour turn‚Äù section.  I now have games as old as 900+ days old appearing in both the ‚Äúyour turn‚Äù section and the ‚Äúgame over section‚Äù.  Dear developer, I appreciate your rapid response but please actually read the entire review before responding.  You don‚Äôt seem to understand the problem.

Original review:

The most recent update has caused my game to display 200+ turns with boards showing up that are over 630 days old.  The ‚Äúwaiting for turn‚Äù games are no longer separated from my ‚Äúyour turn‚Äù games.  And you can no longer get rid of your finished games by swiping and getting rid of them all.  Not that I ever could get rid of them that way.  They‚Äôd disappear only to return as soon as I‚Äôd scroll down to get rid of them.  The game is still very slow once you hit ‚Äúsubmit‚Äù.  Please fix!  Otherwise the game is definitely 5 stars!
Simple and fun

It is so slow recently! Sometimes I hold my phone for 1-2 minutes waiting for a word to play. My only other complaint is that there are so many ‚Äúcheating‚Äù apps out there. Totally out of the hands of these developers, but it makes the game less fun and I don‚Äôt see why play if you‚Äôre using another source for words.

New chat feature is terrific. I can't believe KNOCKERS is on the bad words list, and I wish you needed to double-tap to remove a game (I have removed a few games by mistake!) The game is amazingly addictive. Lots of smart people kicking my butt regularly, but I keep coming back for more. It's brain-stretching good fun! The replay feature seems to have a bug in it. I used to be able to replay a game as soon as it was over. Not so any more. Still, letterpress is a fun game.
Used to be a great app but now it‚Äôs so glitchy

title.label: Fun Game, But Slow to Load

content.label: Upon opening the app it sometimes takes a full minute for your games to appear. Really annoying.

Personally, the problem I have with games like this, and words with friends, is that words like ‚Äúwrongers‚Äù and ‚Äúzuke‚Äù (and many, many more like these) are acceptable. This just allows users to press letters at random and tah-dah some slang word you‚Äôve never heard of works. Wack

It took me awhile to get my mind around the strategy of this game, and I almost deleted it off my phone several times. But now that I understand it, I really enjoy it. 

One suggested improvement: a next game button. When you finish your move in one active game, it would be nice if it gave you the option to go to the next active game, instead of having to return to the menu every time.

title.label: Continues to be one of the best games on iOS

content.label: Years after it‚Äôs release, this game is still phenomenal fun.
I enjoy playing this game with friends a lot. There is a first-move advantage, so I always play loser-starts-next-game to help equalize it. Have fun!
You will enjoy a game with the bot
My fav!!!

I really enjoy this app! I like that I can play a quick moving game against a Bot, or play more leisurely against different people.  It's also nice that there is a built in dictionary, so I can easily learn definitions of new words.  It's a very fun word game!
Been playing for 7 years now.  Can‚Äôt leave home without it
One of the most brilliant word games ever devised, but be ready to accept the poor dictionary connected to it.
Love it so do my friends

So many possible words are not accepted.  Frustrating. Clearly not controlled by fluent English speakers.  This could be fixed, and with all the complaints about this, it is surprising they haven‚Äôt tried to improve.
I love this game! Can‚Äôt get enough of it!
This update broke the app. Freezes upon launch on iPad Pro running iPad OS 13.3.1. Update: 4.9.3 was made available a day later and all issues with the app on iPad Pro seem to be fixed.

The point count should not be deduction, rather it should be added up.
Deducting word points from others doesn‚Äôt make the game fair to players with big points at the last leg of the game.
Not really a great game overtime, except each points are added up at every play.

title.label: A perfect and amazing simple app

content.label: Just a great word game-tons of fun

This used to be one of my favorite games, but I quit playing it a few years ago. I just redownloaded it but couldn‚Äôt even get through a game with one if the bots... the new owners of this game have ruined it. There are obtrusive ads, and the refined design, minimalism and typography of the old letterpress game is gone. Look no further than the bot graphics. How disappointing. Deleted again after ten minutes.
LP disallows ‚Äúrealtor‚Äù as a proper noun, and yet allows ‚Äújello‚Äù.  Latest example of stupidity of its rules.
I enjoy the strategy and thought required to be successful at this game. It is not enough to make up words. You have to decide what letters to use against your opponent.
Game freezing on ads.  When was last update?
I played clandestine as my first word.  Later on my opponent played clandestineness and it was accepted eve though it begins with clandestine.  How does that happen?

At last, a word game where knowing all kinds of absurdly obscure three-letter words will be totally pointless. Anything shorter than eight letters is usually a bad play. Big, fun words! Hooray! And there‚Äôs a strategic component. Love it.
I‚Äôm close to 900 games in and still love the game.

I love that this game isn‚Äôt full of unwanted options and challenges like everything from zynga (who I am boycotting forever based on their aggressive, annoying, self- interested tactics). I‚Äôve convinced all my friends to switch to this great game that I somehow missed originally. We all love it! So many layers to think about and master. Super fun.
Fun, competitive spelling challenge.
